name: chaesar
text: Oh man this strip is true beyond true. I am getting married at the end of July and this has been my experience. Hell this is how I feel every time I go to the damn grocery store. At least MD doesn't require you to have a blood test for syphilis anymore.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Yeah, everyone here in Maryland was really crabby about that rule...

name: gouldgonewild
text: Why are half of my comments terrible puns? I need to learn some control.

name: howwedo
text: I live in Annapolis, and I think I'm just inured to crab puns by now.  So when you did that it was ... natural

name: umbra
text: so you can get syphilis over the counter now, huh?

name: featurelessvoid
text: Not really. On the counter, sometimes, but it takes a while to find the right store.

name: laserblade
text: whoa whoa whoa sorry meant to chubby that

name: picnick
text: I imagined Vladimir Putin saying this.

name: m-dynamite

name: spinynorman
text:
This strip is becoming more and more relevant as I start to gear up to get hitched myself.

Sorry, acheladies. You were really only missing out on two hours of silent drinking a night, with communication being passed only through headshakes and a steady slumping of shoulders as though what you just said physically pained me.

name: tekende
text:
Whoa, spinynorman is getting married! Crazy. Best of luck to you with that.

We're all invited to the wedding, right?

name: spinynorman
text:
Sure. Also, I proposed last Tuesday in Barcelona and she said yes.

The proposal was fucking absurd. I'll post about it when I have the time.

name: spinynorman
text: Fuck it: http://shufflingandmuttering.blogspot.com/2009/04/what-i-brought-back-from-barcelona.html

name: tekende
text:
First off, HELL YES you readin' Jonathan Strange and Mr. Norrell . Such a good book.

Second, nice story! These things are always better and more memorable when they don't work out as planned.
Er, not that I know from experience or anything.

Congratulations, man!

name: tekende
text: Also congratulations on having a book published, that is hell of radical.

name: spinynorman
text: Thanks! It shall indeed be a cool endeavor.

name: doctorbaronking
text: You can always count on Cornelius to coin some epigram or aphorism that sounds like it came from the Algonquin round table. Pure Class.

name: babachewy
text: Especially after he's toasted the old cage.

name: spinynorman
text: GodDAMN I love that phrase

name: lateadopter
text: Cornelius is too classy to say it outright to Beef, but he makes it clear just by sitting unperturbed:  The time you spend worrying about money is time you did not spend enjoying life.

name: chaesar
text: True that lateadopter. Besides, Ray is going to pay for the whole thing of course. He wouldn't be Ray if he didn't do it with mad style. Probably fly the Pope in to do the ceremony.

name: chaesar
text:
UPDATE: Hell yes I called Ray paying for it, but my prediction of the Pope performing rites was trumped by the main man Cornelious.

p.s. I love the title, possibly based off of Married To The Sea's "Shakespeare Got to Get Paid, Son"

name: cailetshadow
text: Cornelius vs the Pope = No Contest.

text: Well, Tigers are cousins to the cat.

No dude, bad move.

" alrit man so beefs' gewtting hhitchd'r sum shti

onepiece fer threst v'yer life sounnds fn dumb to me

but whaever come if you wnt r not

its saterday"

WEDDING, FUCKERS.
SHOW UP.

name: epicurus
text: Normally I would chalk this rant up to pre-wedding jitters but in this case I think it might actually be all Beef on this one. He is hella tight with money. I wonder if he will order three dollars each of champagne for the reception?

text: andre that comes in large plastic bags

name: featurelessvoid

I don't think that she'd mind too much. There's a difference between theater mousakka and endless hidden license fees.

-Darren MacLennan

Nah its cool.

-Dan the rapist

name: tombsgrave
text: You're Darren MacLennan!  I know you from being an RPGnet member.  Mind, I haven't posted in a good month or so for various stupid reasons... but yes, your name is associated with awesome things in my mind.

name: soticoto
text:
The Government charge hella money for you to be married... and then charge hella money again to undo that marriage (they call it divorce)...
They charge for the people involved, for the pieces of paper and even for the fvcking ink. There are also costs for public notaries and stuff.
I know from personal experience.

If that isn't beyond FUBAR, I don't know what is.


Admittedly I managed to get my public notary fee reduced by 50% because I gave the nice legal woman sound advice about what goes on in her Aspergian Son's head...
It pays to be Autistic.

name: sirfrederick
text: It's free here, which is pretty neat.

name: tekende
text: Where? Imagination Land?

name: sirfrederick
text: Funnily enough, no. Well, sort of. In any case, the celebrant does the paperwork, and they're entitled to charge a fee, but won't necessarily do so - especially if their profession is more theology than parties.

name: neonfreon
text: it's just as good of a medium as any other medium is for conveying subtlety in written word.  the issue is that subtlety is hard to convey in written word, period.  it is just magnified on the internet because there are so many people that try and fail to convey it properly.  this probably has something to do with the fact that people tend to make posts on the internet in a hasty fashion - I doubt you spent much time attempting to craft the subtlety in this post - just don't blame it on the internet.

name: twotonturkey
text: I didn't spend a whole lot of time crafting a subtle response because this is a forum on a website about cats that talk.  I don't think the people at the Nobel Institute check on this page too much.

name: psykeres
text:
I know how Beef feels here. There's no grace to the way modern living tries to hide the ways it screws you, like a five-year-old with his fist behind his back.

Cornelius isn't buggin', though. Is this because he's been through a few more wives or because he did his marryin' back when you could get hamburgers for a dime?

text: The price you used to crave, the wife you used to love

name: wolfslice
text:
Look at it this way: this is probably all building to an INSANE wedding party (and maybe a bachelor party beforehand) the likes of which will feature such possible antics as Little Nephew being escorted away by the police for indecent exposure (photographing his ding dong), Vlad getting so drunk that he makes out with Chucklebot, and Lyle, passing out at the alter, pooping in his pants.

Happy Birthday Chris Onstad

name: ljuke
text:
Sorry to go off topic, but last night a friend of mine was wearing an Eraserhead t-shirt that just had a pic of David Lynch's weird head on it and I couldn't stop thinking "Oh boy, I wish I had a t-shirt with a pic of Roast Beef's Eraserhead Homage on it."

I also couldn't find a way of describing that strip to him without losing something in the translation.

name: imitationcrab
text:
Was it David Lynch's head? Jack Nance was the actual guy who played 'Eraserhead'.

Happy Birthday, Mr. Onstad

name: duskbringer
text:
Happy Birthday Mr. Onstad.
May you receive many gifts, words of appreciation and familial love... all through the haze of a soothing boozing.

name: solobuttons

Happy Birthday Chris!

Oh man the blog entry to complement this strip is fantastic. I'd love to get Beef's hat.

name: molesticide
text:
it's chris' birthday? when is chris' birthday? the thirteenth? june thirteenth?

that's my dad's birthday. is my dad chris onstad?

ohh shiiiiiit!

also, great strip, but for the first time EVER, and i am kind of ashamed to admit this, i don't 'get' the last line. this has ever happened to me before, not with achewood. but i respect achewood SO MUCH that i'm willing to sac up and just ask the crew: what is cornelius saying? i think i'm, like thirty per cent there, but some part of it is just eluding me. somebody kick me over the edge on this one.

name: methadone
text:
the government gleans absolutly everything they can out of situations, so when a butcher wastes something even as pointless as a squeal, the government laughs.

they would have taken the squeal

name: _cheesekayke
text: it's from "The Jungle" by Upton Sinclair. At one point he says meatpacking factories use every single part of a pig except the squeal

name: drskradley
text: I love it when Beef is all angry and crap.

name: dasilodavi
text: Isn't Onstad married?  I bet this conversation happened verbatim in his household.

name: catgrl131
text: First Achewood, People!!!!!!!! O, joy of joys!

name: catgrl131
text:
I mean my first. Now i feel stupid.
Oh Well! Let the show go on!

name: catgrl131
text:
Actually, I just remembered that it's the next one.
Yo know what? I think I'll just shut up and let you enjoy your comic.
Good day, fine sirs and madams!

name: tragicone
text: And a good day to you madame!

name: hcaz
text:
Roast Beef gets on the rage. I love Roast Beef. I love him so dearly. Time to consult the shop to see if there is any applicable merchandise available for shipping to New Zealand that won't cost me as much as the time when I thought I could just roll on up to a Department of Conservation campsite and say, "Oh, hi. [Friend] isn't here, but I'll be taking his place. I'll pay the fees now?" They were all,
"No. You can't just do that. It is called illegal. Goodbye."
"What the fuck? The only "il~" it is called is illogical, you fucking vampires! LET ME STAY AT A PIECE OF LAND IN MY OWN FUCKING COUNTRY. FUCK YOU, MY TAXES PAY YOUR WAGES."

name: dueledge
text: I was once amazed at how much it cost to live, but then I died a little inside.

name: dueledge
text: actually to tell the truth I'm a student so I pretty much just live off beer and hangovers.

name: tragicone
text: Cornelius throws out some cool sayings does he not?

name: hardelicious
text: As a recently engaged fellow, I'm feeling Beef's pain, in a such as extreme manner. They charge a fee to cut your cake, even if you have an aunt do it. Your CAKE, man!

text:

text: The simple solution seems to not get married.  It costs you tremendously but gains you nothing.

text: Oh god Onstad wants to be Cornelius SO bad.
